intro: Styphelia balansae, commonly known as the Balansae heath, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, commonly known as the heath or wintergreen family. The plant is characterized by its dense, low-growing shrub form with small, evergreen leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pink, and they bloom in early spring. Styphelia balansae thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in heathland or coastal scrub environments.
